text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This IRM was updated to reﬂect the following organizational changes to the Office of the Commissioner:

a. Under the Office of the Commissioner, removed Chief, Equity, Diversity and Inclusion, Research, Analysis and Statistics, Chief Risk Officer and Office of Compliance Analytics. b. Under the Office of the Deputy Commissioner for Operations Support, added Procurement, Research, Applied Analytics and Statistics, Equity, Diversity and Inclusion, and Office of the Chief Risk Officer to fully align the business supporting organizations under the Deputy Commissioner for Operations Support .

IRM 1.1.5.1(4) - Updated content to reﬂect current operational reporting structure. Due to organizational realignment Chief Equity, Diversity and Inclusion, Research Analysis and Statistics, Chief Risk Officer and Office of Compliance Analytics reports to the Deputy Commissioner of Operations Support. Research Analysis and Statistics and Office of Compliance Analytics offices merged and renamed Research Applied Analytics and Statistics.
IRM 1.1.5.2.1 (2) - Clariﬁed responsibilities of Executive Secretariat Correspondence Office to include controlling and handling executive correspondence.

IRM 1.1.5.4 (4) - Due to organizational realignment added the following organizations to report to the Deputy Commissioner for Operations Support: Procurement, Research, Applied Analytics and Statistics, Equity, Diversity and Inclusion, Office of the Chief Risk Officer.
Removed Office of Chief Risk Officer responsibilities (previously contained in IRM 1.1.5.5) guidance is placed in IRM 1.1.31, Chief Risk Officer organizational and management.
corrections, updates to IRM references, and titles made throughout this IRM section.
IRS employees Servicewide
Table of Contents
Commissioner

) The Commissioner of Internal Revenue presides over the nation’s tax system. The IRS Commissioner ensures that the agency maintains an priate balance between taxpayer service and tax enforcement and the tax code with fairness and integrity. The IRS Commissioner is by the President of the United States and conﬁrmed by the Senate for a year term, and may be reappointed to more than one term. (

) The IRS Commissioner is responsible for establishing and interpreting tax ministration policy and for developing strategic issues, goals and objectives managing and operating the IRS. The IRS Commissioner is responsible for overall planning, directing, controlling and evaluating IRS policies, programs, and performance. (
) The Office of the Commissioner consists of the Commissioner, Deputy Com- missioner for Services and Enforcement, Deputy Commissioner for Support, and their immediate staff. (

) The Commissioner directly supervises the: a. Deputy Commissioner for Services and Enforcement b. Deputy Commissioner for Operations Support c. Special Assistant to the Commissioner d. Chief of Staff e. Chief, Appeals - see IRM
, Appeals f. National Taxpayer Advocate - see IRM
, National Taxpayer g. Chief, Communications and Liaison - see IRM
, Chief, tions and Liaison (

) The Chief Counsel - As the chief legal advisor to the IRS Commissioner on matters pertaining to the interpretation, administration and enforcement of internal revenue laws as well as all other legal matters, the Chief Counsel provides legal guidance and interpretive advice to the IRS, the Treasury De- partment and to taxpayers. The Chief Counsel is nominated by the of the United States and conﬁrmed by the U.S. Senate. The Chief Counsel reports to the Commissioner except as speciﬁed in the IRS Restructuring Reform Act of
The IRS Chief Counsel also reports to the Treasury General Counsel on certain matters. (

) The Special Assistant to the Commissioner is the Commissioner’s Chief Principle assistant. As the IRS Commissioner’s principal advisor on general to the management and administration of the IRS, he or she is a facilitator, and communicator. The Special Assistant to the Commissioner works with the Commissioner, Deputy Commissioners and other members of the commissioner’s office on overall policy, operations and management of the IRS. The Special Assistant to the Commissioner plans, performs and coordi- nates signiﬁcant assignments spanning all program and functional areas including other government organizations; and represents the IRS Commis- sioner in contacts with high-level officials of the U.S. government, foreign governments and non-government organizations. (

) Other Assistants and Senior Advisors to the Commissioner serve on the immediate staff of the IRS Commissioner to provide advice and guidance on variety of policy or technical issues of interest to the Commissioner or the Internal Revenue Manual

The Special Assistant to the Commissioner is the Commissioner’s Chief Principle assistant. As the IRS Commissioner’s principal advisor on general management and administration of the IRS, he or she is a facilitator, organizer and communicator. The Special Assistant to the Commissioner works closely with the Commissioner, Deputy Commissioners and other members of the commissioner’s office on overall policy, operations and management of the IRS. (10-28-2008) Special Assistant to the Commissioner

Other Assistants and Senior Advisors to the Commissioner serve on the immediate staff of the IRS Commissioner to provide advice and guidance on a variety of policy or technical issues of interest to the Commissioner or the IRS.
Organization and (
) The Chief of Staff supervises the: • Deputy Chief of Staff of • Executive Secretariat (

) The Chief of Staff reviews and appraises major policy issues and questions with implications for the IRS’ position on a wide variety of issues. ties include: a. Coordinating the review and analysis of policy proposals of direct to the IRS Commissioner; b. Providing advice and evaluation of proposals, recommendations and reports requiring the IRS Commissioner’s approval; c. Overseeing the management of the IRS Commissioner’s schedule correspondence; and d. Managing a variety of executive oversight and decision-making processes. (
) The Executive Secretariat reports to the Chief of Staff and provides and program support to the IRS Commissioner’s staff and to component within the Office of the Commissioner. (

) The Executive Secretariat Correspondence Office (ESCO) reports to the Executive Secretariat and is responsible for assigning, monitoring and reviewing all ESCO controlled correspondence addressed to the Treasury Secretary, IRS Commissioner, Deputy Commissioners, and the Director, lative Affairs. See IRM
, IRS Correspondence Manual for program responsibilities. (

) The Office of the Deputy Commissioner for Services and Enforcement serves as the IRS Commissioner’s key assistant acting on behalf of the missioner in establishing and enforcing tax administration policy and for IRS’ mission to provide America’s taxpayers top quality service by helping them understand and meet their tax responsibilities. (

) The Deputy Commissioner for Services and Enforcement’s direct reports include the Assistant Deputy Commissioner and oversees the four primary operating divisions and other service and enforcement functions. (
) The following offices report to the Deputy Commissioner for Services and forcement: a. Wage and Investment Division - see IRM
, Wage and b. Large Business and International Division - see IRM

) The Office of the Deputy Commissioner for Operations Support executive leadership for customer service, processing, tax law enforcement and ﬁnancial management operations, and is responsible for overseeing operations and for providing executive leadership on policies, programs activities. The Deputy assists and acts on behalf of the IRS Commissioner directing, coordinating and controlling the policies, programs and the of the IRS; in establishing tax administration policy, and developing issues and objectives for IRS strategic management. (
) The Deputy Commissioner Operations Support reports directly to the sioner and oversees the integrated IRS support functions, facilitating of scale efficiencies and better business practices. (

) The Deputy Assistant Commissioner Operations acts on behalf of the Commissioner Operations Support in directing, coordinating and controlling policies, programs and the activities of the IRS; in establishing tax tion policy, and developing strategic issues and objectives for IRS strategic management. (
